enumValues.name: MILITARY_ADDRESS
enumValues.description: special military address is not permitted

enumValues.name: NEW
enumValues.description: Address is new or just updated, not validated yet

enumValues.name: NORMAL
enumValues.description: We deliver to such addresses, address is normal, passed validation.

enumValues.name: SUPPORT_CONFIRMED
enumValues.description: We deliver to such addresses, address is normal, passed validation.

enumValues.name: USER_CONFIRMED
enumValues.description: We deliver to such addresses, address is normal, passed validation.

enumValues.name: INVALID
enumValues.description: Address didn't pass validation

enumValues.name: UNDELIVERABLE
enumValues.description: We don't deliver to such address, the last shipment with this address was returned.

enumValues.name: UNDELIVERABLE_CHANGED
enumValues.description: Address has been changed after it was in `UNDELIVERABLE` state.

enumValues.name: UNABLE_MANUALLY_VALIDATE
enumValues.description: Address is invalid, not pass automation validation and did't validated manually for customer support.

types.name: Money
types.description: object representation of Money, idea was grabbed from shopify https://shopify.dev/docs/admin-api/graphql/reference/object/moneyv2

types.name: Mutation
types.description:
PURCHASE FLOW

0. Initial steps:
 * add goods to cart (subscription, ecommerce, gift subscription, etc), which will be saved to session
 * apply offer or coupon via mutation `couponApply`, which will be saved to session or clear coupon by `couponClear`
 * get purchase price details via query `purchaseInquiry`
 * user fill UI form with payment method and shipping (billing) address
1. Start purchase session via mutation `purchaseBegin`
2. Send UI form to Recurly to get Token data, for AMAZON_PAY payment type use Amazon lib
3. Complete purchase with received Token data via mutation `purchaseCommit`, submit Recurly/Amazon HTTP error via mutation `purchaseFailed`
4. Check purchase session for assync execution via `purchaseSession`


CHANGE PLAN FLOW: UPGRADE, DOWNGRADE, CHANGE FREQUENCY

1. Get available plans via query `user` at `Subscription.plansInquiry` and ask user on plan desicion
2. Get change price details via query `subscriptionChangePlanInquiry`
3. Start upgrade session via mutation `subscriptionChangePlan`. If result has `METHOD_NOT_VALID` error, than user needs to select/add another payment method.
4. Check upgrade session for assync execution via query `subscriptionChangePlanSession`


SKIP AND PAUSE SUBSCRIPTON FLOW

1. Get refund options via query `user` at `Subscription.refundInquiry` and ask user on refund desicion
2. Skip or pause subscription via mutation `subscriptionSkip`
3. Resume subscription if required via mutation `subscriptionUnskip`

UNSUBSCRIBE FLOW

1. Get refund options via query `user` at `Subscription.refundInquiry` and ask user on refund desicion
1. Get available unsubscribe reasons via query `user` at `Subscription.unsubscribeReasons` and ask user
2. Unsubscribe via mutation `subscriptionUnsubscribe`, using refund desicion and unsubscribe reason
3. Resume subscription if required via mutation `subscriptionResubscribe`. If result has `METHOD_NOT_VALID` error, than user needs to select/add another payment method.


PAYMENT METHODS FLOW

1. New payment method can be added same as purchase via calling mutation `paymentMethodCreateBegin`, getting token from Recurly/Amazon lib, calling `paymentMethodCreateCommit`
2. Primary payment method can be set via mutation `paymentMethodSetPrimary`. Not valid or primary payment method cannot be used.
3. Payment method can be removed via mutation `paymentMethodDelete`

fields.name: couponApply
fields.description:
apply coupon and save to session.
will be applied to subscription in case customer has active one.

fields.name: purchaseOneClick
fields.description:
purchase in single call with existing payment method and shipping address
purchase items and offers are binded same way as for regular purchase

fields.name: subscriptionChangePlan
fields.description: change plan of subscription: upgrade, downgrade, change frequency

fields.name: subscriptionSkip
fields.description: skip months or pause subscription and get refund, please check flow on `Mutation` docs

fields.name: subscriptionUnskip
fields.description: unskip or unpause subscription - regular flow

fields.name: subscriptionUnskipOneClick
fields.description:
unskip or unpause subscription in one click - used when user opens link from email
resumes customer's subscription and defines redirect link for calling client

fields.name: subscriptionUnsubscribe
fields.description: cancel subscription and get refund, please check flow on `Mutation` docs

fields.name: subscriptionResubscribeOneClick
fields.description:
resume subscription in one click - used when user opens link from email
resubscribes customer and defines redirect link for calling client

fields.name: paymentMethodCreateBegin
fields.description: begin creation of the new payment method

fields.name: paymentMethodCreateCommit
fields.description: finish creation of the new payment method

fields.name: cartModify
fields.description: add item or change number of units at user cart

fields.name: pixelApply
fields.description: marketing data sends to back when pixel fires

fields.name: userShareEmail
fields.description: user gives agreement to share email

fields.name: unsubscribeFlowStarted
fields.description: fires when user slick on unsubscribe on UI and started long flow of unsubscription

fields.name: queueMoveItem
fields.description: Move item in queue, change items order

fields.name: paymentPageEventFire
fields.description: payment page sends event data to back when page is opened

fields.name: popupShown
fields.description: set popup already shown for user

fields.name: userPersonalInfoUpdate
fields.description: update user personal information (e.g. first name, email, etc.)

fields.name: caseSubscriptionUpdate
fields.description:
update case subscription settings
old name `setUpchargeForPerfumeCase`

fields.name: referralVisit
fields.description: Create connection for unregistered users who referred by email

fields.name: referralInvite
fields.description: Send an invitation to other users

fields.name: imageHd
fields.description: link to high definition image, used in note landing page

Common error interface
Code of error (errorCode) is typed and must be placed in each interface implementation

fields.name: statusFinalized
fields.description: needed to trigger actions right after purchase session status finalization (e.g. fire analytics event only once)

enumValues.name: NEW
enumValues.description: Set when SubscriptionSession created

enumValues.name: IN_PROGRESS
enumValues.description: Set before we commit SubscriptionSession in Payment Gateway

enumValues.name: FAILED
enumValues.description: Set when commit SubscriptionSession in PG failed

enumValues.name: SUCCESS
enumValues.description: Set when commit SubscriptionSession in PG success

fields.name: createdDate
fields.description: date when the order was purchases

fields.name: deliveryMonth
fields.description:
the month where this order must be delivered, in some specific cases it can be different from created date
for example if customer subscribed on 24 Aug, this field will return September, because we will only ship
subscription order once in the month, and 24 Aug to close to next shipment wave, we plus one month to the
order date and will not send any additional order in September, this Aug order will be counted as September

fields.name: tracking
fields.description: tracking information, only for processed orders

types.name: OrderStatus
types.description: TODO sync with java enum

fields.name: url
fields.description: url to webpage where displayed detailed tracking information (narvar)

enumValues.name: MANUAL
enumValues.description: Coupon was applied manually by customer

enumValues.name: LANDING
enumValues.description: Coupon was applied automatically from landing page

enumValues.name: SITE
enumValues.description: Coupon was applied automatically from site (e.g. resubfreeproduct on resubscribe/unsubscribe flow)

inputFields.name: offset
inputFields.description: skip N items in list, default is 0

inputFields.name: limit
inputFields.description: limit list size no value, default is 40

enumValues.name: GIFT_SUBSCRIPTION_ACTIVATION_ERROR
enumValues.description: error occurred during gift subscription activation

enumValues.name: GIFT_CARD_ACTIVATION_ERROR
enumValues.description: error occurred during gift card activation

fields.name: name

scope that defines for what types of purchases this payment method can be used: subscription or ecommerce only.
Currently payment method is identified as primary if it has SUBSCRIPTION scope

inputFields.description:
billing address, strict validation
required fields: country, postalCode, region, city, street1

inputFields.name: couponCode
inputFields.description: coupon code or offer code which linked to this update paymenth method operation

enumValues.name: METHOD_NOT_VALID
enumValues.description:
INVALID PAYMENT FLOW:
1. If user want to add new payment method, then use `paymentMethodCreateBegin`, `paymentMethodCreateCommit`
2. Use new or another existing payment method by id in `subscriptionResubscribe`, `subscriptionChangePlan`, `paymentMethodSetPrimary`

enumValues.name: METHOD_IS_PRIMARY
enumValues.description: paymemt method is primary, it can not be removed or you can not select is primary

inputFields.name: scope
inputFields.description:
defines what payment methods to retrieve: for subscription related operations or ecommerce
need to pass ECOMMERCE_ONLY for all ecommerce purchase related operations including buy your queue
temporary solution, needed until wallet feature is supported in Recurly

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: can be used for purchase subscription + ecommerce or subscription only

enumValues.name: ECOMMERCE_ONLY
enumValues.description: can be used for ecommerce purchase only

amount of how many perfumes/product user can receive per period,
example: perfumesPerPeriod = 3 and billingPeriod = shippingPeriod = 1 it means: 3 perfumes / 1 month

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION_NOT_FOUND

enumValues.name: ECOMMERCE_NOT_FOUND
enumValues.description: ecommerce products are not added to the cart, can not make purchase for given level

enumValues.name: QUEUE_ITEMS_NOT_FOUND

enumValues.name: GIFT_SUBSCRIPTION_NOT_FOUND
enumValues.description: gift subscription is not added to the cart, can not make purchase for given level

enumValues.name: TAXABLE_ADDRESS_REQUIRED
enumValues.description: Taxable address is required

enumValues.name: ALREADY_ACTIVE_SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Customer already has active subscription

enumValues.name: PRIMARY_METHOD_NOT_FOUND

enumValues.name: EXTERNAL_NETWORK_ISSUE
enumValues.description: Network IO exception happened - timeouts, reset and so on

enumValues.name: AMAZON_BAID_TAKEN
enumValues.description: Other account in the Recurly site already using this Amazon BAID.

enumValues.name: WRONG_PLAN_CODE
enumValues.description: Provided subscription plan code is invalid

enumValues.name: INVALID_TOKEN
enumValues.description: Recurly JS token is either invalid or expired

enumValues.name: PURCHASE_IN_PROGRESS
enumValues.description: Purchase is interrupted by networking, and purchase is finished in async (background) mode

enumValues.name: ANOTHER_PURCHASE_IN_PROGRESS
enumValues.description: Customer tries to purchase twice (double clicks and so on) or more at the same time

enumValues.name: PREPAID_FILTERING
enumValues.description: Customer tries to purchase with prepaid card (currently supported only for free trial)

enumValues.name: RECURRENT_CHARGE_IN_PROGRESS
enumValues.description: Customer tries change plan while recurrent charge in progress

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN

enumValues.description: Purchase gift subscription only, exclude other products inside the cart.

enumValues.description: Purchase e-commerce products only, exclude other products inside the cart (for example subscription).

enumValues.name: ECOMMERCE_AND_SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Purchase subscription and e-commerce products, exclude other products inside the cart

enumValues.name: GIFT_CARD_ONLY
enumValues.description:
this level will purchase or calculate price for gift card only, exclude subscription or other products in
the cart

enumValues.name: OnHold
enumValues.description: skipped 1,2,3 months

enumValues.name: Unpaid
enumValues.description: last payment is not successfull on payment day of the month, when Recurly is not able to charge the user, the status is still active, we can send if the user has credits

enumValues.name: Cancelled
enumValues.description: closed subscription, automatic cancelled

enumValues.name: Paused
enumValues.description: no time restriction, the user should unpause by himself

enumValues.name: Undeliverable
enumValues.description: user with undeliverable address status

enumValues.name: PendingProductRepick
enumValues.description: user paid for lep on subbscription but it became put of stock. He need to repick product SCNT-6507

enumValues.name: Pending
enumValues.description: time gap between payment authorization and charge (SCNT-3660)

enumValues.name: PendingUpgrade
enumValues.description: subscription is waiting for upgrade

enumValues.name: PendingChangePlan
enumValues.description: subscription is waiting for change plan

enumValues.name: PaymentInProgress
enumValues.description: not subscribed, but purchase session is in progress

enumValues.name: OnTechnicalHold
enumValues.description: cases when we cancel order and need to skip month

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByUrl`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if`'argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks the field, argument, input field or enum value as deprecated

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.
